alert.note: Alert for Braxton; Calhoun; Clay; Northwest Nicholas (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 3:42AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Calhoun, northwestern Nicholas, northeastern Kanawha, southwestern Braxton, Roane, Clay and southeastern Jackson Counties through 415 AM EDT... At 341 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong, heavy thunderstorms along a line extending from near Arnoldsburg to Amma to near Sissonville. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Spencer, Clay, Clendenin, Glen, Arnoldsburg, Big Otter, Wallback, Amma, Elkview, Harrison, Nebo, Procious, Muddlety, Indore, Left Hand, Ivydale, Widen, Frametown, Strange Creek and Wilsie. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 10 and 55. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 117 and 121. Route 19 near mile marker 48. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
